Key Match Events: The Denver Nuggets dropped their season opener to the OKC Thunder, scoring just 87 points.
Denver converted on just seven of their 38 three-point attempts (18.4 percent).
Denver’s bench had just one made three-pointer, which came from Russell Westbrook who went 1/6 from beyond the arc.
Post-Match Reflections: Nuggets head coach Michael Malone expressed concern about the team's shooting, especially after losing Kentavious Caldwell-Pope in free agency.
Nikola Jokic admitted that the team is not a good shooting team, except for Mike and Jamal.
